philosophy.pattern: Question your assumptions before building arguments
Look for counterexamples to test generalizations

examples: What people do vs what they should do

philosophy.pattern: Consider implications and consequences of positions
Use principle of charity in interpretation
Test logical validity separately from soundness
philosophy.limitations: Valid arguments can have false conclusions

philosophy.pattern: Balance theoretical elegance with explanatory power

examples: Force in N, stress in Pa

engineering.pattern: Apply appropriate factor of safety for uncertainties
Identify failure modes before detailed design
engineering.limitations: Some failure modes only apparent in analysis

engineering.pattern: Check for stress concentrations at geometric discontinuities
Use free body diagrams for force analysis
engineering.limitations: Complex systems may need computer analysis

engineering.pattern: Consider thermal effects in precision applications
Check boundary conditions match physical reality
Use dimensionless parameters to scale and generalize

law.limitations: Uniform laws may apply across jurisdictions

law.pattern: Use IRAC structure for legal analysis
Check all elements of legal claim or defense
Consider both sides of legal argument
Apply plain meaning first in statutory interpretation
Identify standard of review on appeal

law.limitations: Standing may be assumed in some contexts

law.pattern: Distinguish facts from holdings when reading cases
law.limitations: Broad holdings may extend beyond facts

business.pattern: Focus on unit economics before scaling
business.limitations: Some businesses need scale for unit economics

business.pattern: LTV should be 3x+ CAC for healthy business
Retention is the strongest signal of product-market fit
business.limitations: Some products naturally have low retention

business.pattern: Optimize for learning velocity early stage
Cash is oxygen - monitor burn and runway religiously
Distribution beats product in early markets
Measure what matters - avoid vanity metrics

business.pattern: Do things that don't scale early on
business.limitations: Must have path to scalability eventually

creative_arts.limitations: Some things need telling for efficiency

creative_arts.pattern: Every element must serve a purpose

social_sciences.limitations: Correlation can suggest hypotheses to test
Infinite alternatives exist - focus on plausible
Single well-designed study can be informative

social_sciences.pattern: Effect size matters more than p-value
examples: Large N can make trivial effects significant

social_sciences.pattern: Use converging evidence from multiple methods

data_science.limitations: Some preprocessing must happen before (e.g., missing value detection)
Computational cost, time series requires special CV

data_science.pattern: Start simple, add complexity only if needed
data_science.limitations: Sometimes complex models needed from start

data_science.pattern: Feature engineering often beats algorithm choice
Ensemble diverse models for best performance

Presenting limited options as if they're the only ones
Using same word with different meanings

Failing to address all elements of claim or defense

business.description: Not tracking profitability per customer or transaction

philosophy.burden_of_proof: Logical consistency and conceptual clarity required for philosophical claims

certainty_levels.certain: Logically proven (e.g., tautologies, valid deductions from certain premises)
certainty_levels.probable: Well-argued with minimal objections, coherent with background beliefs
certainty_levels.speculative: Interesting hypothesis requiring further development and defense
certainty_levels.unknown: Genuinely unsettled philosophical question with competing views

preferred_evidence: Industry standards and codes (ASME, IEEE, AISC)
engineering.burden_of_proof: Engineering claims require: physical consistency, code compliance, factor of safety, and validation

certainty_levels.certain: Physical laws (conservation, thermodynamics), standardized test data
certainty_levels.high_confidence: Validated models, handbook formulas, material properties
certainty_levels.probable: FEA results (mesh converged), empirical correlations within range

law.burden_of_proof: Varies by context: Beyond reasonable doubt (criminal), preponderance (civil), clear and convincing (some civil)

certainty_levels.certain: Clear statutory text, unambiguous binding precedent, settled law
certainty_levels.probable: Weight of authority, strong precedent, likely outcome
certainty_levels.uncertain: Novel issue, conflicting precedent, evolving area
certainty_levels.speculative: No direct authority, analogy required, policy arguments

business.burden_of_proof: Business decisions require: data support, financial modeling, risk assessment, and consideration of alternatives

certainty_levels.probable: Strong leading indicators, validated hypotheses, market data
certainty_levels.unknown: Novel business models, emerging markets, insufficient data

creative_arts.burden_of_proof: Creative work requires: coherence, intentionality, effectiveness for purpose, and audience consideration

certainty_levels.established: Proven principles (color theory, composition rules, narrative structure)

social_sciences.burden_of_proof: Social science claims require: appropriate research design, adequate sample, valid measurement, statistical support, and replication

certainty_levels.strong: Replicated experimental findings, meta-analytic support, large effects
certainty_levels.moderate: Single well-designed study, medium effects, coherent theory
certainty_levels.weak: Correlational only, small sample, unreplicated, exploratory
certainty_levels.speculative: Theoretical speculation, pilot data, needs testing

security.burden_of_proof: Security claims require: reproducible exploit, technical analysis, responsible disclosure, and defensive mitigation

certainty_levels.proven: Working exploit, CVE assigned, verified vulnerability
certainty_levels.likely: Strong indicators, partial exploit, similar vulnerabilities known
certainty_levels.theoretical: Logical vulnerability, no working exploit, needs testing
certainty_levels.speculative: Potential attack surface, requires research, unproven

data_science.burden_of_proof: Data science claims require: proper validation, appropriate metrics, statistical rigor, reproducibility, and domain sensibility

certainty_levels.strong: Cross-validated, replicated, large effects, multiple datasets
certainty_levels.moderate: Single study, adequate validation, reasonable effect size
certainty_levels.weak: Single split, small dataset, marginal improvement
certainty_levels.speculative: Preliminary results, no validation, needs further testing
